title: Trump isolated after trade escalation with Europe over Greenland
subhead: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

title: A 'night of deep pain' for Spain after fatal train collision
Portugal presidential election: Socialist Antonio Jos√© Seguro leads in first round
From Trump to Nvidia, Davos prepares for American might
subhead: The president of the world's largest economy is attending the World Economic Forum in Switzerland from January 19 to January 23, positioning himself as a conqueror. This year's edition will be shaped by rising international tensions and artificial intelligence.

title: Iranian artists exiled in France voice distress over massacres
subhead: Petrified by the horror stories coming out of the country, Iranian artists living in exile in France keep a close eye on their home. They worry about their loved ones and eagerly await rare news, which is often relayed by someone lucky enough to escape the internet blackout.

title: Gen Z thirsts for a digital detox: 'I felt bad after every use, quitting lifted a huge weight off me'
subhead: More and more young people are feeling dependent on their screens, and taking steps to regain control over their digital device use by deleting social media apps and limiting their screen time.

title: The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhead: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.

subhead: For several weeks, Minnesota's largest metropolitan area has been living under the strain of Operation Metro Surge, which saw the deployment of 2,000 Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers. Since the death of Renee Good on January 7, tensions with residents have reached a peak.

title: By appearing with a royal heiress, Jordan Bardella risks blurring his image
subhead: The president of the far-right Rassemblement National presents himself as the 'authentic spokesperson for a France despised by the elites,' yet was photographed in the company of the daughter of Prince Carlo of Bourbon-Two Sicilies, Duke of Castro.

title: Istanbul's ultra-violent gangs tighten their grip on the city
subhead: In Turkey's major cities, criminal gangs made up of teenagers and young adults have grown rapidly in recent years, fueled by a boom in synthetic drug trafficking.
